description: The type of relationship captured by the relationship record.
comment: Primary Key for the RELATIONSHIP table.

description: Defines whether a relationship organizes concepts into classes or hierarchies. Values are 1 for hierarchical relationship or 0 if not.
comment: Indicates if the relationship is hierarchical.

description: Defines whether a hierarchical relationship contributes to the concept_ancestor table. Valid values are 1 or 0.
comment: Indicates if the relationship contributes to concept_ancestor.

description: The identifier for the relationship used to define the reverse relationship between two concepts.
A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique relationship concept.
